sentences.en: Entitled William Eggleston's Guide, it was the first show of colour photography at Moma, a decision that incensed the critics almost as much as the supposedly banal and vulgar subject matter.
sentences.cn: 这次名为“威廉·埃格斯顿指南”的展览，是纽约现代艺术博物馆的第一场彩色摄影展。 展示彩色作品，激怒批评家的程度，几乎不下于这些作品所谓平庸和粗俗的题材。

sentences.en: Even the thought of this utterly incensed the student leaders.
sentences.cn: 那些学生领导人即使一想到这种建议,就会怒火中烧.

sentences.en: He drew his chair forward; he pushed it back; he looked perfectly incensed , and perfectly helpless.
sentences.cn: 他一会儿把坐椅向前挪, 一会儿又把坐椅往后推, 他显得火冒三丈, 也显得束手无策.

sentences.en: He felt deeply incensed by / at the way he had been treated.
sentences.cn: 他受到那样的待遇感到非常愤怒.

sentences.en: He followed her, incensed that she'd dared to leave him alone.
sentences.cn: 他跟着她，对她竟敢对自己置之不理感到极其愤怒。

sentences.en: I became incensed at her behavior.
sentences.cn: 我对她的行为感到愤怒.

sentences.en: I was incensed by her rudeness.
I would rather be incensed than saddened.
sentences.cn: 我情愿给惹得发怒,也不情愿给惹得悲哀.

sentences.en: Mum was incensed at his lack of compassion.
sentences.cn: 妈妈被他缺乏同情心的表现激怒了。

sentences.en: Not surprisingly, the unions were incensed, but failed to stop the Bill going through Parliament.
sentences.cn: 不言而喻, 工会强烈反对, 但未能阻止议会通过这次提案.

sentences.en: She did not know why she was so angry. But she was incensed.
sentences.cn: 她不知道自己为何这么生气, 但她就是感到怒不可遏.
这个决定激怒了劳工大众。

sentences.en: The decision to reduce pay levels incensed the work - force.
sentences.cn: 降低工资的决定激怒了工人.

sentences.en: They were incensed at the decision.
sentences.cn: 他们被这个决定激怒了。

sentences.en: This proposal will incense conservation campaigners.
sentences.cn: 这项提议将激怒自然保护的倡导者。

sentences.en: We were incensed by their bad behaviour.
sentences.cn: 我们被他们的恶劣行为激怒了.

trans.tran_cn: 激怒（incense的过去式与过去分词形式）
trans.tran_en: If you say that something incenses you, you mean that it makes you extremely angry
